results.title: The Vital link
results.creator_credit: Rank Audio Visual, M.J. Clark and W. J. Allen
results.brief_description: Examines the development of transport routes, how the preferred means of transport is usually a compromise between convenience, speed and cost and some of the problems caused by an ever increasing dependence on transport in our everyday lives.

results.title: The Vital conductor
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Quantum”.
This is the second program in Quantum’s occasional series ‘The Universe within’, featuring Karina Kelly and Geoffrey Burchfield. It describes the function performed by the liver and looks at its ability to regenerate.

results.title: The Visitor
results.brief_description: The Visitor is a dramatisation of Ray Bradbury’s science fiction short story. “Blood Rust” victims are exiled to the barren deserts of a quarantine planet to prevent spread of disease on Earth. When a new arrival at the distant colony displays a mystical ability to recreate memories of Earth in the minds of the outcasts, his gift becomes the target of envy and aggression.

results.title: The Visit of the London Symphony Orchestra
results.brief_description: A record of the first Australian visit of the London Symphony Orchestra which performed at the 1966 Adelaide Festival of Arts. Later they visited Sydney where they were the first to play in the Sydney Opera House.

results.title: The Visit
results.creator_credit: BFI, John Hall and Jack Gold
results.brief_description: A searching study of suburban futility. Shows in painstaking and intricate detail the chilling, deadening aimlessness of an unmarried woman’s existence - an existence divided between the exhausting monotony of machine-minding and the nervous strain of caring for her stolid, vacant, fractious parents. The routine is broken by a relative’s telephone call wanting to pay a visit and introduce his fiancee. For Alice the natural behaviour of the young couple is a revelation, bringing home to her, her own desperate situation and the implacable passage of time. Cast includes: Alice Spaul, Eunice Phelps, George Wood.

results.title: The Visit
results.creator_credit: Julian Biggs, ONF | NFB and Bernard Devlin
results.brief_description: Paul, a young French Canadian, is caught between two ways of life, and must choose for himself between the old and the new. After a two year absence, Paul returns to the Quebec village where he grew up. His father hopes he will stay and take over his boat-building trade. Despite family ties, Paul sees the inevitable change that is coming to the province and responds to the stronger call of the industrial world.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Julian Biggs, ONF | NFB and Bernard Devlin

results.title: The Vision
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, John Shaw, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Little world of Dietmar Fill”.
This video concentrates on the alpine flora and fauna but also discusses Dietmar’s vision of the natural world. It focuses in the corroboree frog and again, the photography is excellent. Narrated by Robyn Williams.

results.title: The Virgin suicides [DVD]
results.creator_credit: American Zoetrope, Paramount Classics, Muse productions, Francis Ford Coppola, Julie Costanzo, Dan Halsted, Chris Hanley and Sofia Coppola
results.brief_description: Sofia Coppola’s feature debut is an elusive and intoxicating work about the beautiful Lisbon sisters, five teenage girls who mysteriously and tragically decide to end their lives. Based on Jeffrey Eugenides cult novel, the story of these girls is filtered through the idealized eyes of the boys in their neighbourhood, who, years later, try to make sense of the Lisbon sisters lives and deaths. Coppola captures perfectly the essence of a difficult book which is as much about the disintegration of idealism in the 70’s as it is about the joys and pains of adolescence. Working with potentially dark material, Coppola appropriately infuses the film with a sense of nostalgic longing that is both seductive and melancholy. Narrated by Giovanni Ribisi. Cast includes: Kirsten Dunst, James Woods, Kathleen Turner, Josh Hartnett, Michael Pare, Scott Glen and Danny DeVito.

constellations_other.name: Iconic creative partnerships
constellations_other.description: Actor Nicholas Hoult and writer-director Tony Mcnamara worked on The Favourite together before Hoult was cast in The Great. Strong creative partnerships between particular actors and directors are the backbone of screen creativity.

results.title: The Virgin queen
results.creator_credit: Charles Brackett, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Henry Koster
results.brief_description: Bette Davis gives her second memorable performance as Queen Elizabeth I in this swashbuckling historical drama that also features Joan Collins in an early screen performance. It is the story of the aging queen’s attraction to handsome Sir Walter Raleigh (Richard Todd) and her bitter clash with a scheming, younger rival (Collins). Rich in historical detail, lavish with authentic cotumes and period decor and enlivened by thrilling swordplay, “The Virgin Queen” is a legendary re-creation of one of England’s most fascinating eras, made all the more alluring by Davis’ dynamic performance.
